gurmukhi: ਹੁਤੀ ਨੰਦਨੀ ਸਿੰਧ ਜਾਕੀ ਸੁਪੁੱਤ੍ਰੀ || ਤਿਸੈ ਮਾਂਗ ਹਾਰਯੋ ਸਹੰਸਾਸਤ੍ਰ ਛੱਤ੍ਰੀ ||
transliteration: Houtinandanisindh Jaakisoupouttree|| Tisai Maan Hdaryo Sahansaastra Chhattree||
translation: Nandini, the wish-fulfilling cow like the daughter of Yamadagni and the Kshatriya Sahasrabahu had got tired in begging it from the sage.

gurmukhi: ਲੀਯੋ ਛੀਨ ਗਾਯੰ ਹਤਯੋ ਰਾਮ ਤਾਤੰ || ਤਿਸੀ ਬੈਰ ਕੀਨੇ ਸਭੈ ਭੂਪ ਪਾਤੰ ||੭||
transliteration: Leeyo Chheen Gadyan Hatyo Raam Taatan|| Tisibair Keene Sabhai Bhoop Paatan||7||
translation: Ultimately, he snatched away the cow and killed Yamadagni and in order to wreak his vengeance, Parashurama destroyed all the Kshatriya kings.7.

gurmukhi: ਗੲੀ ਬਾਲ ਤਾਤੇ ਲੀਯੋ ਸੋਧ ਤਾਕੋ || ਹਠਯੋ ਤਾਤ ਮੇਰੋ ਕਹੋ ਨਾਮੁ ਵਾਕੋ ||
transliteration: Gadbaal Taate Leeyo Sodh Taako|| Hathyo Taat Mero Kaho Naam(u) Vaako||
translation: Form the very childhood Parashurama had been quite inquisitive in his mind about the identity of the killer of his father;

gurmukhi: ਸਹੰਸਾਸਤ੍ਰ ਭੂਪੰ ਸੁਣਯੋ ਸ੍ਰੳੁਨ ਨਾਮੰ || ਗਹੇ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਅਸਤ੍ਰੰ ਚਲਯੋ ਤੳੁਨ ਠਾਮੰ ||੮||
transliteration: Sahansaastra Bhoopan Sounyo Sraoun Naamannd|| Gade Sastra Astran Chadyo Taoun Thaamannd||8||
translation: And when he came to know that it was the king Sahasrabahu, he moved towards his place with his arms and weapons.8.

gurmukhi: ਕਹੋ ਰਾਜ ਮੇਰੋ ਹਨਯੋ ਤਾਤ ਕੈਸੇ || ਅਬੈ ਜੁੱਧੁ ਜੀਤੋ ਹਨੋ ਤੋਹਿ ਤੈਸੇ ||
transliteration: Kaho Raaj Mero Hanyo Taat Kaise|| Abai Juddh(u) Jeeto Hano Toh(i) Taise||
translation: Parashurama said to the king, “O king; how hast thou killed my father? Now I want to wage war with you in order to kill you;”

gurmukhi: ਕਹਾ ਮੂੜ ਬੈਠੋ ਸੁ ਅਸਤ੍ਰੰ ਸੰਭਾਰੋ || ਚਲੋ ਭਾਜ ਨਾ ਤੋ ਸਭੈ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਡਾਰੋ ||੯||
transliteration: Kahaa Moond Baitho Su Astran Sanbdaro|| Chalo Bhaaj Naa To Sabhai Sastra Daro||9||
translation: He also said, “O fool, hold your weapons, otherwise forsaking them, run away from this place.”9.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਣੇ ਬੋਲ ਬੰਕੇ ਭਰਯੋ ਭੂਪ ਕੋਪੰ || ੳੁਠਯੋ ਰਾਜ ਸਰਦੂਲ ਲੈ ਪਾਣ ਧੋਪੰ ||
transliteration: Soune Bol Banke Bdaryo Bhoop Kopan|| Outhyo Raaj Sardool Lai Paan Dhopan||
translation: Hearing these ironical words, the king was filled with fury and holding his weapons in his hands, got up like a lion.

gurmukhi: ਹਠਯੋ ਖੇਤ ਖੂਨੀ ਦਿਜੰ ਖੇਤ੍ਰ ਹਾਯੋ || ਚਹੇ ਅਾਜ ਹੀ ਜੁੱਧ ਮੋ ਸੋ ਮਚਾਯੋ ||੧੦||
transliteration: Hathyo Khet Khoonidijan Khetra Haayo|| Chahe Aaj Hijuddh Mo So Machadyo||10||
translation: He came to the arena of battle with determination, knowing that the Brahmin Parashurama was desirous of fighting with him on the same day.10.

gurmukhi: ਧੲੇ ਸੂਰ ਸਰਬੰ ਸੁਨੇ ਬੈਨ ਰਾਜੰ || ਚੜਯੋ ਕ੍ਰੁੱਧ ਜੁੱਧੰ ਸ੍ਰਜੇ ਸਰਬ ਸਾਜੰ ||
transliteration: Dhae Soor Saraban Soune Bain Raajan|| Chadyo Kruddh Juddhan Sraje Sarab Saajan||
translation: Hearing the furious words of the king, his warriors in great ire, decorating themselves (with their weapon) marched forward;

gurmukhi: ਗਦਾ ਸੈਹਥੀ ਸੂਲ ਸੇਲੰ ਸੰਭਾਰੀ || ਚਲੇ ਜੁੱਧ ਕਾਜੰ ਬਡੇ ਛੱਤ੍ਰ ਧਾਰੀ ||੧੧||
transliteration: Gadaa Saihthisool Selan Sandhdaree|| Chale Juddh Kaajan Bade Chhattra Dhdaree||11||
translation: Holding firmly their tridents, lances, maces etc., the great canopied kings moved forward for waging war.11.
